text: Lones Wesley Wigger Jr. (August 25, 1937 â€“ December 14, 2017) was an American sports shooter. In his shooting career, he won 111 medals, including three Olympic medals. He won a gold and silver medal at the 1964 Olympics and a gold medal at the 1972 Olympics. He was also a lieutenant colonel in the U.S. Army. He was born in Great Falls, Montana. Wigger died of pancreatic cancer on December 14, 2017 in Colorado Springs, Colorado. He was 80. ==References== ==Other websites== * Lones Wigger at Sports-Reference.com Category:1937 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Olympic gold medalists for the United States Category:Olympic silver medalists for the United States Category:Medalists at the 1964 Summer Olympics Category:Medalists at the 1972 Summer Olympics Category:People from Great Falls, Montana Category:Sportspeople from Montana Category:American sport shooters
title: Lones Wigger
